item.title: Deutsche Bank ernennt Teamleiter Private Markets Deutschland
item.author: Citywire Deutschland
item.description: Die Deutsche Bank hat Andrew Hinrichsen zum Teamleiter Private Markets Deutschland ernannt. Er wird per April in Frankfurt tätig sein und berichtet an Sebastian Elsner, Leiter Global Private Markets. item.title: HSBC in Talks to Sell Fund Administration Arm to BlackFin
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- HSBC Holdings Plc is in advanced talks to sell its German fund administration business to BlackFin Capital Partners, people with knowledge of the matter said. The private equity firm is working to hammer out final terms of a deal to buy HSBC’s Inka unit, which has about €400 billion ...

item.title: Private Equity Firms Are Getting Rid of Their Equity
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Private equity firms are called that because they own stakes in the companies they buy. Today, this assumption is looking ever more outdated. As buyout funds struggle to sell businesses in a moribund M&A market — not helped by President Donald Trump’s tariff gyrations — many are turni...

item.title: Beginn des Deutschland-Jahrzehnts – diese 7 Fonds und ETFs wären die großen Gewinner

item.description:
